intro: Josemania singularis, commonly known as the star of Borneo, is a striking flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, star-shaped flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves that are opposite in arrangement, adding to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Josemania singularis is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its eye-catching blooms and compact growth habit.
